Name: Sophy
AboutMe:
I am Dr. Emanuel Donchin's graduate student in the Department of Psychology at the University of South Florida. Before entering this program, I was working on a project examining the mechanisms of local sleep in wakefulness and behavioral performance in the Department of Psychiatry, University of Wisconsin-Madison. My current focuses are:

  • to explore the brain's executive control system with EEG
  • to advance the P300 based brain computer interface (BCI), a system enables severely disabled individuals with intact cognitive system (e.g., ALS patients) to communicate using computer devices;

I hope to gain a better understanding of how the mind is implemented by the brain, and gather new insights into consciousness and cognitive function.
